summary: Comprehensive testing of SEO Network Ranking Visibility & Status Indicator feature. All 9 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI verified: ranking status badges on network cards, green border for ranking networks, mini metrics display, ranking filter dropdown, and sort dropdown all working correctly.

backend_api: Project A network correctly has ranking_status='ranking' with position #2
frontend_ui: SEO Networks page loads with 5 network cards
Each network card displays ranking status badge (Ranking/No Ranking)
Project A shows green 'Ranking' badge with TrendingUp icon
Other networks show gray 'No Ranking' badges
Project A network card has green border highlight (border-emerald-500/30)
Mini metrics visible on Project A: '1 ranking', '#2', '1 tracked'
Brand filter dropdown visible and functional
Ranking status filter dropdown visible and functional
Sort dropdown visible with options: Default, Best Position, Most Ranking Nodes
Filtering by 'Ranking' status shows only Project A (1 network)
Sorting by 'Best Position' shows Project A first

critical_code_review_comments: RankingStatus enum properly defined in models_v3.py with RANKING, TRACKING, NONE values
get_networks endpoint correctly computes ranking metrics by querying structure entries
Ranking status logic: 'ranking' if position 1-100 OR has ranking_url, 'tracking' if has keyword/url but no position, else 'none'
Filter and sort parameters handled after fetching and computing metrics (post-query filtering)
GroupsPage.jsx properly renders ranking badges with getRankingStatusBadge helper function
Green border applied via conditional className: border-emerald-500/30 for ranking networks
Mini metrics section only displayed when ranking_nodes_count > 0 or tracked_urls_count > 0
seed_data_creation: No new seed data created. Used existing 'Project A' network with ranking_position=2 on one node.
context_for_next_testing_agent: SEO Network Ranking Visibility feature fully tested. The API returns ranking_status (ranking/tracking/none), ranking_nodes_count, best_ranking_position, tracked_urls_count for each network. Frontend displays ranking badges on network cards, green border for ranking networks, and mini metrics (X ranking, #Y position, Z tracked). Filter by ranking status and sort by best position/ranking nodes both work correctly. Project A network is the test network with ranking data (position #2).
